channel.title: Schedule Events [Java/MySQL]
channel.description: Ok, so I am working on a ban system. The names/IPs are stored in a MySQL table `Banned`. Now my problem is I want the removing of names/IPs to be handled outside of the java program. That way If someone get's banned or muted for 3 days, he server won't have to cycle every 500 ms to see if the current time is after the ban period. I was thinking of using cron or something like that, but I remember seeing something in a MySQL client about scheduling events. However I can't find a fully featured MySQL client that's freeware, or open source. So what would be the best way about doing this?
